[[app]]
[[howto-section]]
[[content]]
[[howto-title]]
== Apple security updates (15-Jan-2008 to 03-Dec-2009)

This document outlines security updates for Apple products from
15-Jan-2008 to 03-Dec-2009.

This article has been archived and is no longer updated by Apple.

[[sections]]
For the protection of our customers, Apple does not disclose, discuss or
confirm security issues until a full investigation has occurred and any
necessary patches or releases are available. To learn more about Apple
Product Security, see the Apple
http://www.apple.com/support/security/[Product Security website].

*Important*: This document describes updates and releases from
15-Jan-2008 to 03-Dec-2009. For newer releases, see
http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222[this article]. For information about
earlier security updates, see these documents:

* http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1263[Apple security updates (25-Jan-2005
to 21-Dec-2007)]
* http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1646[Apple security updates (03-Oct-2003
to 11-Jan-2005)]
* http://www.info.apple.com/kbnum/n25631[Apple security updates (August,
2003 and earlier)]

=== Obtaining Mac OS X

Information about obtaining Mac OS X (client) can be found
http://www.apple.com/macosx/[here]. Information about obtaining Mac OS X
Server can be found http://www.apple.com/server/macosx/[here].

Software updates for Mac OS X are available via:

* http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1338[Software Update] preferences
* http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/[Apple Downloads]

=== Apple Product Security PGP Key

For information, see http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1620[How to use the
Apple Product Security PGP Key].

=== Security updates

[[tableWraper]]
[width="100%",cols="34%,33%,33%",]

|===

Â (*) Based on an IEEE 802.11n draft specification.

=== Security updates are usually incorporated into later Software Updates

Security updates released for Mac OS X are usually incorporated into the
next Mac OS X Software Update.

Security updates may also be available for software released
independently from Mac OS X. Software Updates are packaged in a manner
to keep systems secure. Security updates are only offered to systems
that need the update, and not to later versions that have incorporated
the Security Update. For more information, see the "Some, but not all,
updates are displayed" section of
http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1569[this document].[.G10G]#* +
*#

*Important:* Information about products not manufactured by Apple is
provided for information purposes only and does not constitute Appleâs
recommendation or endorsement. Please
http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2693?viewlocale=en_US[contact the vendor]
for additional information.

Published Date:Â November 16, 2011

[.form-counter]#250#

Please donât include any personal information in your comment.

[.form-message]#Maximum character limit is 250.#

Submit

[[rating-done]]
Thanks for your feedback.
